hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 10-day ATR compression to <2% of price, a breakdown below the 20-day Bollinger Lower Band on >1.5x average volume signals a transition to BEAR regime with 70% probability within 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility in neutral regimes often precedes directional breaks. Compression metrics combined with volume confirmation provide high signal-to-noise for bearish transitions. Regulatory uncertainty (MiCA/UK consultations) may amplify breakdowns.
entry_conditions: BTC closes below 20-day Bollinger Lower Band (2σ)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims 20-day SMA and closes above it
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days without BEAR regime confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals fail to transition to BEAR regime within 5 days OR false breakdowns (reclaim within 48h) exceed 35% of signals.
